[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The THEMAS defines requirements to optimize energy consumption and operational efficiency in facilities.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: THEMAS supports real-time monitoring, predictive analytics, and automated energy management.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: THEMAS integrates with building automation, smart meters, and IoT devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: THEMAS provides dashboards and mobile-friendly interfaces for facility managers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: THEMAS runs on cloud-hosted servers and IoT hardware.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: THEMAS supports APIs for third-party integrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: THEMAS uses secure MQTT and HTTPS protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The system ensures efficient memory use on embedded devices, optimizing performance while maintaining minimal energy consumption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: THEMAS ensures 24/7 availability with planned maintenance and automated failover to minimize downtime.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: The system scales to diverse facilities, adapting to different energy infrastructures and operational needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: THEMAS connects with external analytics, compliance platforms, and energy regulation databases for monitoring and reporting.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: THEMAS monitors energy, analyzes patterns, and optimizes consumption.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include facility managers, energy analysts, and system administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: THEMAS relies on stable internet connectivity and functional IoT hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: THEMAS requires operational IoT devices and API integrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Energy Analytics: Analysis of energy use patterns.
Dashboard: UI for monitoring real-time metrics.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with IoT devices for energy data collection.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support APIs for third-party analytics tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall provide energy usage trends and historical data.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable automated energy optimization based on rules (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide customizable dashboards for visualization.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support WCAG 2.1 accessibility compliance.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall display energy data within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 1,000 concurrent users at peak hours.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store energy data and logs securely (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall enable role-based access and real-time updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall be compatible with AWS and Azure cloud platforms.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall follow modular design principles.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR for data protection.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet ISO 50001 energy management standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall support dynamic scaling for growing data volumes.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all critical actions for auditing.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Setup guides, user training, IoT integration manuals, and Energy optimization practices.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 50001, MQTT standards, and GDPR compliance.
